org.jboss.aerogear.unifiedpush.message

Class UnifiedMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jboss.aerogear.unifiedpush.message.UnifiedMessage

  • public class UnifiedMessage
extends Object
    A UnifiedMessage represents a message in the format expected from the Unified Push Server. The message format is very simple: A generic JSON map is used to send messages to Android, iOS and Windows devices. The applications on the devices will receive the JSON map and are responsible for performing a lookup to read values of the given keys. See the Message Specification for more information.

    To construct a message use the withMessage() like this : 

     
     UnifiedMessage unifiedMessage = UnifiedMessage.withMessage()
             .alert("Hello")
             .sound("default")
             .criteria()
                  .variants("c3f0a94f-48de-4b77-a08e-68114460857e") // e.g. HR_Premium
                  .aliases("mike", "john")
                  .categories("sport", "world cup")
                  .deviceType("iPad", "AndroidTablet")
             .build();
